info.game_comments: The Final Jeopardy! screen displays the clue incorrectly in the studio, disadvantaging a challenger and resulting in him being invited back later in the year.

(1, 1).clue: 1884:"You don't know about me without you have read a book by the name of 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer'"

(2, 1).clue: Despite his nickname, this left fielder for the 1919 Chicago "Black Sox" didn't usually play barefoot

(3, 1).clue: Hair emerges from this tiny pore in the skin

(5, 1).clue: This city isn't just about cable cars; its classic Muni streetcars run past the historic piers

(6, 1).clue: This name won a 1966 contest in the New Orleans States-Item newspaper for the city's new NFL team

(1, 2).clue: 1859: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times"

(2, 2).clue: HOFer Ralph Kiner became an announcer known for quotes like "McReynolds stops at" this base "and he scores"

(3, 2).clue: From the Latin for "little key", it's another name for the collarbone

(6, 2).clue: This "colorful" conservation group asked the internet to name a humpback whale & we got Mr. Splashy Pants

(3, 4).clue: Swallowing or yawning can equalize the pressure in this, also called the auditory tube

(6, 4).clue: After letting the internet vote on the name of 2 moons circling Pluto, SETI chose Kerberos & this river

(1, 5).clue: 1952: "Roy Hobbs pawed at the glass before thinking to prick a match with his thumbnail"

(2, 5).clue: Some weren't happy CEO Derek Jeter & this team traded young left fielder Marcell Ozuna after his great 2017 season

(3, 5).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a model of the knee on the monitor.) These two ligaments, one posterior & one anterior, stabilize the knee & get their name from the fact that they cross in a "X" shape

(6, 5).clue: Boaty McBoatface won a poll for the name of a big polar ship, but instead, the name chosen honors this British naturalist

(1, 1).clue: Only this ex-76er & TNT analyst could say he was misquoted in his own 1992 autobiography, "Outrageous!"

(2, 1).clue: Kevin Bacon gets some cents drilled into him by Magneto in this group "First Class"

(3, 1).clue: Between 1844 & 1851, Ireland's population dropped more than 20% as a result of this disaster

(5, 1).clue: Far from any mosque, one of these prayer towers rises above the Hari River in remote central Afghanistan

(6, 1).clue: In bowling, a 3-10 or 2-7 is called a baby this
